intro: Potentilla recta subvar. besseri, commonly known as the Bessera cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features erect, branching stems covered in fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are palmately divided into five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subvariety is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine environments.
